page.title: 01Introduction to the Area
page.content: The area is basically rich farmland on et clay to the north and dry sands to the south.Most people live in 3 village Kingston Bagpuize is the largest and busiest.Modern estates have now swamped the old settlement along the main road. There are shops,clubs and societies. Fyfield's recorded history began in 956.A population of 200 live in 65 houses, half of which are extremely old. Apart from a council estate of 24 houses built in 1948 the majority of the village is owned by St. John's College as is all of the surrounding land. Few are involved in the primary industry-agriculture. Tubney has a population of about 183. There is little social life in the village which consists of mainly large houses and people with businesses in and around Oxford.
